verses.verse: Who<WH4310> has believed<WH539> our report?<WH8052> and to whom<WH4310> is the arm<WH2220> of the LORD<WH3068> revealed?<WH1540>

For he shall grow<WH5927> up before<WH6440> him as a tender<WH3126> plant, and as a root<WH8328> out of a dry<WH6723> ground:<WH776> he has no<WH3808> form<WH8389> nor<WH3808> comeliness;<WH1926> and when we shall see<WH7200> him, there is no<WH3808> beauty<WH4758> that we should desire<WH2530> him.

He is despised<WH959> and rejected<WH2310> of men;<WH376> a man<WH376> of sorrows,<WH4341> and acquainted<WH3045> with grief:<WH2483> and we hid<WH5641> as it were our faces<WH6440> from him; he was despised,<WH959> and we esteemed<WH2803> him not.
Surely<WH403> he has borne<WH5375> our griefs,<WH2483> and carried<WH5445> our sorrows:<WH4341> yet we did esteem<WH2803> him stricken,<WH5060> smitten<WH5221> of God,<WH430> and afflicted.<WH6031>

But he was wounded<WH2490> for our transgressions,<WH6588> he was bruised<WH1792> for our iniquities:<WH5771> the chastisement<WH4148> of our peace<WH7965> was on him; and with his stripes<WH2250> we are healed.<WH7495>

All<WH3605> we like sheep<WH6629> have gone<WH8582> astray;<WH8582> we have turned<WH6437> every<WH376> one<WH376> to his own way;<WH1870> and the LORD<WH3068> has laid<WH6293> on him the iniquity<WH5771> of us all.<WH3605>

He was oppressed,<WH5065> and he was afflicted,<WH6031> yet he opened<WH6605> not his mouth:<WH6310> he is brought<WH2986> as a lamb<WH7716> to the slaughter,<WH2874> and as a sheep<WH7353> before<WH6440> her shearers<WH1494> is dumb,<WH481> so he opens<WH6605> not his mouth.<WH6310>

He was taken<WH3947> from prison<WH6115> and from judgment:<WH4941> and who<WH4310> shall declare<WH7878> his generation?<WH1755> for he was cut<WH1504> off out of the land<WH776> of the living:<WH2416> for the transgression<WH6588> of my people<WH5971> was he stricken.<WH5061>

And he made<WH5414> his grave<WH6913> with the wicked,<WH7563> and with the rich<WH6223> in his death;<WH4194> because<WH5921> he had done<WH6213> no<WH3808> violence,<WH2555> neither<WH3808> was any deceit<WH4820> in his mouth.<WH6310>

Yet it pleased<WH2654> the LORD<WH3068> to bruise<WH1792> him; he has put him to grief:<WH2470> when<WH518> you shall make<WH7760> his soul<WH5315> an offering for sin,<WH817> he shall see<WH7200> his seed,<WH2233> he shall prolong<WH748> his days,<WH3117> and the pleasure<WH2656> of the LORD<WH3068> shall prosper<WH6743> in his hand.<WH3027>

He shall see<WH7200> of the travail<WH5999> of his soul,<WH5315> and shall be satisfied:<WH7646> by his knowledge<WH1847> shall my righteous<WH6662> servant<WH5650> justify<WH6663> many;<WH7227> for he shall bear<WH5445> their iniquities.<WH5771>

Therefore<WH3651> will I divide<WH2505> him a portion<WH2506> with the great,<WH7227> and he shall divide<WH2505> the spoil<WH7998> with the strong;<WH6099> because<WH8478> <WH834> he has poured<WH6168> out his soul<WH5315> to death:<WH4194> and he was numbered<WH4487> with the transgressors;<WH6586> and he bore<WH5375> the sin<WH2399> of many,<WH7227> and made intercession<WH6293> for the transgressors.<WH6586>
